brief_description of the content in the: The source URL provides information about the usage of <code> tags in Javadoc comments. It suggests that since Java 5, these tags can be replaced with {@code ...} constructs, which allows using angle brackets < and > inside the comment instead of HTML character entities.
generated_rule_explanation from GPT-4: The rule 'replace_code_with_javadoc_tag' checks all the Java files for any usage of <code> tags in Javadoc comments of methods. If it finds any, it asserts that the comment should not contain the <code> tag and suggests replacing it with the {@code ...} construct. The rule uses the built-in functions getFiles(), getClasses(), getMethods(), getComment(), contains(), getName(), and getFQN().
PRE_model_validation: The rule 'replace_code_with_javadoc_tag' is syntactically correct and follows the RSL syntax. It uses only the built-in functions and does not introduce any new functions. The rule checks for the usage of <code> tags in Javadoc comments and suggests replacing them with {@code ...} constructs.
